intro: Sauropus albicans var. zeylanicus, commonly known as the white-leaf sauropus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white, velvety leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its primary appeal lies in its aesthetic appearance.
